Description: Upper body sherd of Chian, possibly Animal Chalice, Grand or Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centre; exterior: around rim (now lost), two dilute lines, the lower part of the rim frieze; below, painted decoration consisting of undetermined motif, possibly a hand holding up a pomegranate.
Curator's comments: The two lines around the rim and the interior decoration are consistent with the Animal Chalice, Grand and Chalice Styles.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0692) (phase 2)
